required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Mechanical Ventilation Modes on Oxygenisation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Mechanical Ventilation Strategies on Tissue Oxygenization of Patients Undergoing Bariatric Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison the effect of two different mechanical ventilation modes on tissue oxygenization.

detailed_description.textblock: Aim of the study is to evaluate and compare the effects of two different mechanical ventilation modes as Volume Controlled Mechanical Ventilation (VCV) and Pressure Controlled Mechanical Ventilation (PCV) on non invasive tissue oxygenization levels of patients who scheduled for bariatric surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: peroperative 0. minute - 15. minute - 30. minute - 45. minute - 60. minute
primary_outcome.description: Peroperative Non invazive technique of Superficial Tissue Oxygenization

primary_outcome.time_frame: post operative 1. hour - 4. hour - 8. hour - 12. hour - 24.hour
primary_outcome.description: Post operative Non invazive technique of Superficial Tissue Oxygenization
Lactate, Ph, Arterial oxygen pressure, Arterial Carbondioxide pressure, Oxygen Saturation
Lactate, Ph, Arterial oxygen pressure, Arterial Carbondioxide pressure, Oxygen Saturation

primary_outcome.time_frame: peroperative 0. minute - 15. minute - 30. minute - 45. minute - 60. minute

secondary_outcome.time_frame: peroperative 0. minute - 15. minute - 30. minute - 45. minute - 60. minute
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate, Mean Arterial Blood Pressure
Heart rate, Mean Arterial Blood Pressure

study_pop.textblock: Study population involves the elective bariatric surgery patients who have body mass index between 35 and 50 kg/m2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients with Body Mass Index 35 - 50 kg/m2 Patients classified as American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) 1-2-3 classification Patients elected for Bariatric surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients who wants to reject of study participation Patients who has any surgical complication during the surgery period Patients with decompensated cardiac failure Patients with Moderate or Severe obstructive/restrictive lung disease Patients with Reynaud disease Patients with Buerger phenomena Patients whÄ±o has Intraoperative airway pressure more than 45 cmH2O Patients who had previous thoracic surgery Patients with Negative Modified Allen test
